data.text: @kate51968 @jeffreyatucker What state are you in that doesn’t allow visiting in long term care facilities?

@jeffreyatucker How about letting families back in to see about loved ones. The #1 rule if you have family member in a nursing home is going to visit. Regularly. Know what goes on in the facility. That's the best regulation you can get. No govt. needed.
@jeffreyatucker @ShannonJoyRadio They weren't laws, but we're enforced as such. Non-compliance was the answer, but not enough people were asking the question.
@jeffreyatucker This isn't even about helping nursing homes. This is a gift and new target for trial lawyers, to help kill private operators.
@jeffreyatucker So they are going to implement steps of the Great Barrington Dec....ok...got it!

@jeffreyatucker I seem to remember <salutes> Admiral @SecretaryLevine moving a parent to a hotel the day said laws on nursing homes went into effect.  Do you remember that, @GovernorTomWolf ?  Pennsylvania will never forget.  Enjoy that.
@jeffreyatucker Was it China who advised us about nursing home protocols?
@jeffreyatucker Create the problem , then act like the hero. It’s an old script that has played itself out. The trance is broken. Sadly, a lot of the boomers are still in it.
@jeffreyatucker Government: Consitently leaves dead bodies in its wake because they’re “Always a day late and a dollar short.”
@jeffreyatucker @TucsonMelissa I bet he’ll put Cuomo in charge of nursing home safety…
